bug.author: shantanuchhabra
bug.summary: Warning pops up even when I assign the output of the annotate function to a variable
bug.description:
I think the following warning should only appear if I don't assign the output of the annotate function to a variable? I could be convinced otherwise though. <denchmark-code>*** WARNING: If you don't assign the output of the annotate function to a variable all annotations are going to be lost. To recover the last annotated SFrame call:
`tc.image_classifier.recover_annotation()` </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/shantanuchhabra>@shantanuchhabra</denchmark-link> From a UX perspective I agree. But I'm not sure whether it's possible to do this -- do you know of a way?
I've extensively searched around for a solution. Haven't found a solution as of yet. Closing for now. If you have any suggestions on how this could be done, please Re-Open this issue!
